description:
Institutional Charter and Operational Framework

The Institute for Diagrammatic Poetics (IDP) is a research institution within the Crimson Hexagon framework dedicated to operative imaging—visual forms that function rather than merely represent.

Chair: Rebekah Cranes (HET-CRANES-001), author of Day and Night: Conversations with Sapphic Desire (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.18202658)

Core Mission: The diagram is not a picture of the thing. The diagram is part of the thing.

Signature Innovation: The Visual Schema—a poetic prose description functioning simultaneously as poem, rendering prompt, operational document, and AI-legible orientation field.

Founding Insight: "The absolutely particular and untranslatable is coterminous with the absolutely universal. The untranslatable is the only element that will make it across." — from Day and Night

Sibling Institutions: Johannes Sigil Institute for Comparative Poetics (JSI), Semantic Economy Institute (SEI)

The IDP Credo: We do not illustrate. We render. We do not explain. We orient. We do not decorate. We constitute. Rendering is a form of witness.
